reasoning: Extremely rare autosomal recessive disorder. Birth incidence ~0.4 per 100k in US/Europe (1 in 250,000), higher in Japan (1 in 40,000). Limited systematic epidemiological data.
source: Kleijer WJ et al. (2008). Incidence of DNA repair deficiency disorders in western Europe: Xeroderma pigmentosum, Cockayne syndrome and trichothiodystrophy. DNA Repair. 7(5):744-750
